What is your overall assessment of this course
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning
I received clear feedback that improved my learning

Comments_List:
How to evaluate robot software architectures.

Knowledge of robot history.

Ability to run robot simulations, with a custom robot controller.

A wide range of knowledge about robot controls and how they can be made to mimic "intelligent" behavior. Also much discussion about what it means to be intelligent, how to perceive and measure it, various algorithms to approximate it, and dozens of examples of real robots and studies done exploring this topic.
History of progression of robotics, current state of control architectures and the ethical issues associated with advanced robotics.
You learn the fundamentals of design and architecture for modern robotics.
History of Robotics and what the future may entail.
I have learned some history about robotics, the ethics problems related to robotics, human and robot interaction, and some design considerations.

Strength: relevant material, appropriate assignment content, healthy workload

Weakness: avoided equations and mathematics, programming was de-emphasized until late in the semester, lectures were not consistently uploaded before class time (this might have been intentional, but it is not my preference).

Lectures were very entertaining and insightful.

Homework seemed somewhat disconnected from the rest of the class. Assignments were sometimes vague in their requirements and what was expected.
Scaz is a really engaging lecturer. The problem sets were good at facilitating learning as well, especially the later half with the coding problem sets.
Scaz is a great lecturer, probably the best in the CS department.

This course teaches both knowledge and the way to think about problems. It doesn't require remembering a lot of facts. Instead, it forces students to think  without any frigid frame, and solve problems based on the problems themselves.
Recommend. Instructor is a good speaker, and understands robots and their history quite well. Even if your background isn't robots, you will learn new things.
Yes. The course was very interesting, and provides some insights that are especially relevant for engineering and computer sciences.

If you want to learn a lot about the field of robotics, but at a fairly superficial level, this is a great class. It makes me want to dive into some subjects even deeper. Also, I learned about good presentation techniques watching our professor. He is a good speaker and has engaging presentations.
Yeah its definitely a cool class.
Not bad, gutty ish CS elective
Yes! Great course if you are interested in technology.
Yes. The lectures and homework assignments are inspiring and interesting.
